segment.source: Release Notes for DaRT 10
segment.target: Release Notes for DaRT 10

segment.source: Release Notes for DaRT 10
segment.target: Release Notes for DaRT 10

segment.source: Release Notes for DaRT 10
segment.target: Release Notes for DaRT 10

segment.source: To search these release notes, press CTRL+F.
segment.target: To search these release notes, press CTRL+F.

segment.source: Read these release notes thoroughly before you install Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 10.
segment.target: Read these release notes thoroughly before you install Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 10.

segment.source: These release notes contain information that is required to successfully install Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset 10.
segment.target: These release notes contain information that is required to successfully install Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset 10.

segment.source: The release notes also contain information that is not available in the product documentation.
segment.target: The release notes also contain information that is not available in the product documentation.

segment.source: If there is a difference between these release notes and other DaRT documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.
segment.target: If there is a difference between these release notes and other DaRT documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.

segment.source: These release notes supersede the content that is included with this product.
segment.target: These release notes supersede the content that is included with this product.

segment.source: Known issues with DaRT 10
segment.target: Known issues with DaRT 10

segment.source: Disk Commander is unable to repair a corrupt master boot record in a physical partition in Windows 10
segment.target: Disk Commander is unable to repair a corrupt master boot record in a physical partition in Windows 10

segment.source: In Windows 10, the “Restore the Master Boot Record (MBR) or the header of the GUID Partition Table (GPT)” option in Disk Commander is unable to repair a corrupt master boot record in a physical partition, and therefore is unable to boot the client computer.
segment.target: In Windows 10, the “Restore the Master Boot Record (MBR) or the header of the GUID Partition Table (GPT)” option in Disk Commander is unable to repair a corrupt master boot record in a physical partition, and therefore is unable to boot the client computer.

segment.source: Workaround: Start Startup Repair, click Troubleshoot, click Advanced options, and then click Start repair.
segment.target: Workaround: Start Startup Repair, click Troubleshoot, click Advanced options, and then click Start repair.

segment.source: Multiple instances of Disk Wipe that target the same drive cause all instances except the last one to report a failure
segment.target: Multiple instances of Disk Wipe that target the same drive cause all instances except the last one to report a failure

segment.source: If you start multiple instances of Disk Wipe, and then try to wipe the same drive by using two separate Disk Wipe instances, all instances except the last one report a failure to wipe the drive.
segment.target: If you start multiple instances of Disk Wipe, and then try to wipe the same drive by using two separate Disk Wipe instances, all instances except the last one report a failure to wipe the drive.

segment.source: Workaround: None.
segment.target: Workaround: None.

segment.source: Disk Wipe may not clear all data on solid-state drives that have flash memory
segment.target: Disk Wipe may not clear all data on solid-state drives that have flash memory

segment.source: If you use Disk Wipe to clear data on a solid-state drive (SSD) that has flash memory, all of the data may not be erased.
segment.target: If you use Disk Wipe to clear data on a solid-state drive (SSD) that has flash memory, all of the data may not be erased.

segment.source: This issue occurs because the SSD firmware controls the physical location of writes while Disk Wipe is running.
segment.target: This issue occurs because the SSD firmware controls the physical location of writes while Disk Wipe is running.

segment.source: Workaround: None.
segment.target: Workaround: None.

segment.source: System restore fails when you run Locksmith Wizard or Registry Editor
segment.target: System restore fails when you run Locksmith Wizard or Registry Editor

segment.source: If you run Locksmith Wizard, Registry Editor, and possibly other tools, System Restore fails.
segment.target: If you run Locksmith Wizard, Registry Editor, and possibly other tools, System Restore fails.

segment.source: Workaround: Close and restart DaRT, and then start System Restore.
segment.target: Workaround: Close and restart DaRT, and then start System Restore.

segment.source: System File Checker (SFC) Scan fails to run after you start and close Locksmith Wizard or Computer Management
segment.target: System File Checker (SFC) Scan fails to run after you start and close Locksmith Wizard or Computer Management

segment.source: If you start and then close Locksmith Wizard or tools in Computer Management, System File Checker fails to run.
segment.target: If you start and then close Locksmith Wizard or tools in Computer Management, System File Checker fails to run.

segment.source: Workaround: Close and restart DaRT, and then start System File Checker.
segment.target: Workaround: Close and restart DaRT, and then start System File Checker.

segment.source: DaRT installer does not fail when the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit is not installed
segment.target: DaRT installer does not fail when the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit is not installed

segment.source: If you install DaRT 10 by using the command line to run the Windows Installer (.msi), and the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) has not been installed, the DaRT installation should fail.
segment.target: If you install DaRT 10 by using the command line to run the Windows Installer (.msi), and the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) has not been installed, the DaRT installation should fail.

segment.source: Currently, the DaRT 10 installer installs all components except the DaRT recovery image.
segment.target: Currently, the DaRT 10 installer installs all components except the DaRT recovery image.

segment.source: Workaround: None.
segment.target: Workaround: None.
